text: Aus der Flasche 2016-12 getrunken. Oh ja das Rotweinfass hat hier eine tolle Frucht in dieses traumhafte Quardrupel geazubert. Perfekt balanciert. Geiles Zeug.

330ml bottle, thanks to Boutip. Burgundy with a a thin ring of white foam. Flavors are red wine, toasted cereals, raisins, dried fruits, molasses, port and chocolate. Assertive warming alcohol but never overbearing. Full body, soft carbonation, oily texture.

0,33l bottle brewed in 03/2013. Pours very dark brown colour with no head. Aroma of malts, sugar, syrup, alcohol, dried fruits, red wine, sweet liquor. Full body, very sweet taste, not very bitter, slightly boozy overall but surprisingly balanced. Heavy and complex beer.

Bottle. Brewed 04/04/13 / Batch: 950. Dark Brown color with one finger of beige head that faints quickly as expected by the abv.Aromas of red wine, some cognac, wood an dark fruits. Moderate carbonation with a hint of an alcoholic burn when you first taste it.Sticky texture.Highly addictive taste ,you can drink it for hours.Sweet ,spicy and not overall boozy for the 15,5% abv. it carries. World class Quad.

Bottle. Dark brown color, almost no foam. Aroma: very complex, oak, liquor, red wine, roasted and caramel malt, dried fruit, esters. Taste: strong, sweet, sherry, caramel and chocolate, alcohol. Great wine :)

0.33L bottle, batch 950. Dark brown color, almost no head with tiny traces of beige. Spicy nose with cloves and anise, burnt caramel, dried fruit. Heavy sweet taste, alcohol, brown sugar, spicy, ginger, cloves, raisin. Full body, soft to flat carbonation, sticky texture. Overall: Too sweet, not my kind of quad.

Piana sycząca, niska, nietrwała. Barwa ciemno brązowa, nieprzejrzysta. Aromat intensywnie beczkowy, słodowy, estrowy - jest tu i wanilia, i świeży kokos, i czerwone wino, i wiśnia w czekoladzie, i stara dębina, i likier karmelowy, i suszone owoce... Super. W smaku półsłodkie, lekko kwaskowe, likierowo wine. W posmakach czekolada, kawa, daktyle. Generalnie smakuje prawie tak dobrze, jak pachnie... prawie, bo całość psuje nieco zbyt wysoki alkohol, który mógłby się jeszcze ułożyć.Wysycenie średnie, treściwe i złożone w odbiorze.
Cudowny aromat, bogactwo doznań, złożoność smaku... Podejrzewam, że za jakieś 2 lata na leżaku byłby to ideał, póki co alkohol odrobinę burzy odbiór całości...
Dark brown with no head. Fruity and woody tones. Fruit, malt, wood and hops. Full body with a nice malty/ fruity finish.

0,33l bottle shared with wiosna @ One Pint Pub. Pours clear deep amber with no head. Aroma is sweet malts, brown sugar, alcohol and some red wine. Flavor is sweet malts, sherry, alcohol, red wine and some hops. Loads of chocolate in the finish. Great.

Bottle - Boozy, vinous and red fruit. Very big and bold. Jet brown with a light brown head. Sticky dark fruit and barrel, tobacco notes. Much more balanced and subtle than the nose. Bit of heat on the throat.
Brown black colour, white head. Aroma of wood and brown sugar. Sweet flavour, cacao, malts and brown sugar. Light sweet finish, brown sugar, red wine. Nice!(from 33cL bottle @ Leuven Innovation 15)
Tasting at MattsDark brown, opaque. The aroma is a bit too boozy, the flavor is more malty, quite rich, moderately sweet, some brandy, light nuts.Excellent.

330mL bottle, pours a deep dark mahogany with a small beige head. Aroma is very complex, with loads of red wine barrels, followed by dry caramel and toasted notes -- not a huge alcohol quality. Flavour has a shitload going on, with red wine barrels, perfume, toasted dry caramel and dry dark fruits. Fairly boozy, but with a lovely warming quality. A little harsh and perfumey, but really nice for what it is.

Dull dark brown. No head. This has a nice red wine barrell, light phenols and some stewed fruits. Sweet, has a lot of red wine, plus light esters and phenols from the quad. But none of the cloying. Very nicely balanced, actually, with great fruity character balanced by alcoholic dryness.

Bottle, 33cl. Sparkling dark brown with a minimal head. Aromas of dried fruits, roasted malts, port wine, alcohol. Medium to full bodied, moderate to fizzy carbonation. Medium to heavy sweet, medium bitter. Rich roasted and red fruit flavors into a controlled alcohol finish. Like a port wine. Heavy, but doesnt seem so.

Bottle, 330ml. A dark brown beer with a small red hue and no head. Aroma is of dried fruits and alcohol. Taste is medium bitter and heavy sweet with faint carbonation. Robust bodied, oily and with an aftertaste of dried fruits. Very heavy and with a plump and alcoholic finish.

Backlog - thnx to Phille! Pours dark brown, small white head. Smell is malty, heavy on the red wine. Complex. Taste is fairly bitter, fruity by the wine. Dry, malty taste towards the end. Good MF, bit too sharp carbo. Bit sweet. nice !

You groovin you shakin, you find the one Norwegian dessert wine specified as such. Well Hell, its not bad anyways, you pop open the cork an Toro Y Moi is on the Stereo. I dont think there has been another singer who is so divisive to this generation: hes either pure shite, boring as hell, or brilliant as fuck. Well, you got a beer between those opinions anyways to make amends. I did a hard pour with this into a wineglass and the head was barely present, less a point fer that me dear Norwegian gangstas. The aroma is mud and fusel alcohol, a bit of barley and coffee, wanting something more, wishing to want, my mind has gone, on the verge of cryin, its missin here. At least I think I tell her that the flavour is grape-ish barley, lots of sweetness, unnecessarily so, bread and dark chocolate and too much cloying sugar on this one. Drinkable to be sure, but flavour is missing; this is a molasses bomb in all the senses of the word, too much sweetness and other crap while any so-called talent and control has been left to the wayside. I know you Norwegian bruisers: you can make high booze beers. But make them sing? I haint not yet seen it.

330ml bottle pours a deep amber almost black color with a finger of light brown head that leaves only a few spots of lacing behind. Aroma is red wine grapes with some caramel and other fruits. Taste is a fruity and caramel malty sweetness with a light spicy hop bitterness. Definite alcohol presence. Medium bodied with mild carbonation. Overall, one hell of a kick ass quadruple that is a definite sipper for an after-dinner aperitif.

Bottle 330ml. [ As Nøgne Ø Quadrupel (Red Wine Barrel Edition) ].ABV: 15.5%. Clear dark red brown color with a small, frothy - fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, caramel, buzzy, sweet malt, wood - wet wood, wine - red wine, alcohol. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate acidic with a long duration, sweet malt, dried fruit, red wine, oak, wood, alcohol, buzzy. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20160422]

Negro con reflejos caoba y espuma beis que desaparece pronto. Aromas de frutos rojos, chocolate, madera, turba, licor. Cuerpo denso, sabor de fruto rojo intenso ligeramente ácido, achocolatado leve, final seco que se une en el regusto a una acidez afrutada.

Bottle 330ml. Served at cellar temperature. Pours a dark brown (virtually black). Head is medium sized, lightly tanned and last well. Aroma is of dusty Belgian chocolates, spiced rum, dark cherries, dates, raisin bread, burnt caramel, vanilla extract and wood. Flavour is extremely smooth and complex; marsala wine, treacle, stewed prunes, overripe plums, figs, cherries, spiced rum and raisin chocolate and vanilla/oak. Full bodied with an oily texture and a long, warming finish. ABV is very well hidden. Would be interesting to try this aged (after 5-10 years of cellaring).

A reddish copper ale with a thin mocha head. In aroma, sweet fruity malt with loads of dark fruits, molasses, plum, light soy sauce, alcohol warmth, very nice and complex. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity malt with loads of dark fruits, molasses, plums, light maple, alcohol warmth, very nice. Bottle at Mondial 2016.

Bottle. Almost black with a good coat of light tan head that hangs around at the rim. Loads of dried and stewed fruit, some roasted notes, dough, oak. Quite PX sherry-like. Immensely sweet with lovely fruit, strong dough, oak and oxidised flavours nicely corralled by a moderately bitter and spicy finish. But also booze and plenty of it. It is a bit hot, but I guess it also helps lighten the texture a bit. And whilst its not enough to spoil the show, nobody made them make it so strong (I guess this - brewed in April 13 - is my last pre-takeover beer). Is it enough that at this strength its otherwise complex and harmonious?

Brown bottle, 0.33 l, lot 950, brewed on 04.04.13, via Philippe Boutin (merci!), savoured on May 19 2016; eye: dark brown, opaque, minuscule ring of beige head, no lacing; nose: fruity, malt, fig, light alcohol; mouth: malt, fruity, fig light alcohol, slight alcohol warmth, fruity finale with presence of alcohol, full body, average carbonation, rather sweet, vinous and lightly alcoholic texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 0,33 l, lot 950, brassée le 04.04.13, via Philippe Boutin (merci!), savourée le 19 mai 2016; il : brun foncé, opaque, minuscule anneau de mousse beige, pas de dentelle; nez : fruité, malt, figue, léger alcool; bouche : malt, fruité, figue, léger alcool, très léger chaleur dalcool, finale fruitée avec présence dalcool, corsée, carbonatation moyenne, plus tôt sucrée, texture vineuse et légèrement alcoolique; en résumé : bien

Bottle: Poured a cloudy murky dark brown color ale with a small foamy head with very limited retention and no lacing. Aroma of candi sugar and dry fruit with strong vinous notes is quite complex. Taste is a complex mix of dry fruits with some candy sugar and caramelized sugar notes with some strong red wine notes and oak notes. Body is full with limited filtration and low carbonation with no real apparent alcohol. A bit of strange mix between the red wine barrel and the sweet base beer but it does work.

Bottle @ Home. Pours dark brown with a small light brown head. Aroma of sweet malt, caramel, wet wood, oak, dried fruit, red wine, berries. Flavor is rather sweet, rich malty, caramel, wood, oak, berries, redwine, boozy. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, sweet finish with loads of warming alcohol. 230416

330ml bottle from Den Nordiske Ølhandel, Copenhagne. Brygget 04.04.13, batch nr. 950. Pours dark reddish brown with a smooth bubbly head. Aroma of vinous notes, berries, wood, oak, tannins, plum, yeast and syrup. Taste is sweet, vinous and slightly boozy with some stingy wooden notes, oak, berries, tannins and plums. Finish is heavy, sweetish and oaky with some vinous notes, hints of berries and ripe fruits. Quite heavy

33 cl bottle @ home. Batch #950, brewed 04.04.2013
Aroma has strong red wine notes, wood and mild licorice tones. Flavour has red wine, licorice and some fruity tones. Also wood. Balanced and pleasant.

330 ml bottle. Pours a dark brown colour with a small off-white head. Aroma of deep sweet dried fruits, some caramel, rather heavy wooden notes and grass. Flavour of sweet malts, heavy red wine notes, strong tart wood, some licorice and grass. Full bodied. Alcohol burns. Sweet and heavy.
Bottle. Pours muddy brown with tan head. Aroma of nutty, red wine notes, dried fruits, caramel, malty licorice, toffe, vinous. Heavy swet, fruit and dark fruits.
Bottle. Small head with short duration. Color is dark brown. Aroma and taste are rich dried fruits, alcohol, caramel, rich malt and hops. Oily palate, but low drinkability.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Clear brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, wood, alcohol and red wine. Flavor is very sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and moderate bitter finish with heavy alcohol. A bit boozy. 220416

Bottle. Frothy off-white fair mostly deminishing head. Dark red amber colour. Moderate malty and light hoppy aroma. Powerfull moderate malty and light hoppy flavor. vinius and alcoholic. Average moderate bitter finish.
Shared with kraddel: Quite good, but a bit too heavy in my opinion... I think you can make a quadrupel as good as this one, but a lot lower in alcohol.. Was happy I could share this bottle.

Bottled (Vinmonopolet, Kirkenes). Brownish amber colour, mediumsized brown head. Aroma is alcohol, raisins, some toffee and mild spices and liquorice. Flavour is sweet redwine like wooden and liquorice notes with some spices, yeast and ripe fruity notes. Gets a bit too sweet and sticky when it gets warm.

Bottle (Vinmonopolet). Dark brown color, small beige head. Caramel, red wine, berries and some alcohol. Complex. Medium-bodied to full-bodied. Toffeeish, wineous, some alcohol. Nice complex quadrupel.

Muddy brown with red here and there and no head to speak of. Aroma has red wine, tannin, dried fruits, and slight vanilla from the red wine barrel. Taste is sweet with caramel malts, syrup, tannin and red wine. Also some oak wood. Full body with totally flat carbonation.
Strong ripe fruits. Strong sweet taste, with anticipated ripe fruits. Real dessert beer. Sweet. Almost wine like, but.... quadrupel.

Bottle at Cafe Sara, april 29th 2015. Dark brown body, minimal lacing. Malty aroma with dark wood, carame, vanilla, cherries. Taste is highly yeast spicy with toast, dark malt and plums, an amazing complexity between fruits and sweetness. Warm vineous finish, peaant cherry and choco aftertaste. A damn nice quad!

Bottle at home. Three year old bottle. Pours a slightly hazy dark brown color with a small light brown head. Aroma of dried fruit, oak, brown sugar, chocolate, liqueur, alcohol and leather. Flavour with more dried fruit, heather, liqueur, oak and roasted undertones. Hints of red wine. Has sticky and slick mouth feel, full-bodied and light bitterness. A very complex but balanced quad. Nice and sweet.

Bottle, batch #950, brewed 04.04.13. Aroma is raisin, nuts, toffee, plum, chocolate, dark fruits. Dark brown, cloudy, minimal light brown head. High sweetness, light bitter, taste is port, raisin, chocolate, cocoa, dark plum, some alcohol, hints of wood, marzipan, vanilla. Full body, soft carbonation, long complex finish with some alcohol warmth. Fantastic!
33cl bottle from firma bier or etre gourmet. Color is dark brown. Thin beige head. Medium sweetness. Light bitterness. Aroma is malty, fruity, wood, spicy, light roasted.

Bottle, 15.5%. Unclear very dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is malt, dark fruit, red wine, oak, wood and yeast. Flavour is malt, dark fruit, red wine, oak, wood, spices, caramel, sweet, warming, candy with notes of alcohol.

33 cl bottle @ Pub Kultainen Apina. Batch #950. Brewed on 04.04.2016
Pours very murky brown color with a very small head. Aroma is very appealing with ripe fruits, subtle vinous notes, yeast and wood, some caramel and plums. Caramel malt and plums on the flavor, raisins, wooden tanginess and Madeira notes. Sweet sticky sugary palate. Alcohol is present but not quite as strong as I was expecting. Quite nice slow sipper.
6326

Nesten helt svart med lavt brunt skum. God lacing. Kaffe, lakris, marsipan ognoe tørket frukt i duften. Portvinsaktig smak, noe romrosin. Tykk og deilig munnfølelse, men hadde forventet den enda mer ekstrem. Alkoholen godt tilstede både i lukt og smak.

Az egyik legizgalmasabb típus a sörök világában véleményem szerint a belga stílusú darabok között keresendő, nevezetesen a quadrupel az, amely szédületes mélységek és szemkápráztató sokszínűség hordozója, ha pedig az egyébként is nehézsúlyú főzet érlelés alá kerül, onnantól nincs megállás a végtelenül sokrétű ízvilág létrejötte felé. Ez esetben vörösboros hordó szolgált otthonául nem kevés ideig a masszív italnak, ennek eredményeképpen pedig egy olyan szerkezet elevenedett meg, amely utánozhatatlan módon jeleníti meg mindazt, ami minden quadrupel sajátja kell, hogy legyen, annál azonban még jóval többet is, amely tulajdonságok azonban csak a legkivételesebb darabok sajátjai. A sötétségbe burkolózó ital krémes, bézs színű habbal a tetején festői képet ad, illatmolekulái pedig szinte mérhető súllyal rendelkeznek. A karaktere mázsás komponensek jelenlététől hangos, a desszertszerű ízvilág, melyre a címke is felhívja a figyelmünket, roskadozik az ízjegyek tömegétől. Zseniális, ahogyan a félédes vörösborok zamata adja meg az elegáns keretét a sörnek, amely bár szőlőt vélhetően igen keveset látott, e tulajdonsága mégsem gátolja meg abban, hogy a bor az első dolog legyen, amire asszociálhatunk ízét illetően. Az érlelés ez esetben valóban nemesítő jelleggel hatott a főzetre. A diós, zserbós és mazsolás hangulatok átjárnak minden kortyot, melyek teltebbek már nem is lehetnének, ezekre aztán egy likőrös, fekete cseresznyés, befőttes lepel kerül, hogy zárásként enyhe füstös, hamus és sültes képek tegyék még gazdagabbá a benyomások tárházát. Isteni ital, az egyik legkomplexebb quadruepel, amelyet valaha megalkottak.

0,33 l bottle Brewed: 04.04.13 ffrom Biervana 
resin, caramel, floral, cereal, woody, red-brown color, clear, frothy, brown foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, full body, oily feel, slick feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

Couleur noire, très légère mousse. Fort nez fruits noirs macérés, vieilles prunes, alcool avec note de café et sucrée. Gout de liqueur de fruits noirs-cassis-café, vineux, bon porto, avec notes boisée fut de vin, alcool, sucre. Corps liquoreux mais doux et rond en bouche. Fin longue liquoreuse, fruitée sucrée. A déguster lentement, magnifique.

Bottle 33cl, a dark beer with low head. Nose is intense on dark malt, caramel, coffee, plum and alcohol. Aroma is very sweet on dark caramel, dry grapes, vinous, porto / madere notes, fig, toffee, light peated touch, very complex, more a barley wine, very sweet, soy sauce touch. Long dandied fruit and plum aftertaste.

Small beige head dark brown pour medium carbonation aromas chocolate plum the red wine note nice woody touch caramel yeast doughy fruits rich dark the flavours dried fruits red wine superb barrelling good taste plum woody taste doughy note mild caramel chocolate grain smoothness cherry taste the finish a good Quadruple sweet and some balance with a bitter note well made good malts barrelling like the red wine taste warming Quadruple

Rating #1500!
Nøgnes previous attempt at a red wine barrel aged quad, the over-carbonated Aurora Australis, wasnt that successful in my opinion. In that one the sour red wine notes were too intrusive and not well integrated with the quad notes. The one in my glass this evening however... It pours a very deep amber to brown body, with a small but fully lasting beige head that leaves some lacing on my glass. The aroma is complex and very strong, I get delicious notes of sweet fruits, raisins, cask wood, vanilla, leather and roasted malt. In the back I get some red wine, but also some bourbon-like notes (which I guess is due to the oak) and chocolate. Complex, stunning and strong flavour of dark dried fruits (now more prune-like instead of the raisins in the aroma), sweet generic fruits, roasted malt, caramel, wood and vanilla. Less obvious notes include port wine, red wine, white mould cheese and warming and pleasant alcohol. Its a very sweet brew indeed, and there is not much bitterness in the long-lasting finish, so youll have to have a sweet tooth to really enjoy this one. Amazing mouthfeel, its of course full-bodied, has a syrupy and smooth texture and is softly carbonated. By far the best red wine barrel aged beer Ive ever had! Instead of giving overwhelming notes of sour and cheap red wine, the barrels first of all give rise to a woody vanilla heaven that blends perfectly with the sweet fruity quad notes. Fantastic! 
[33 cl bottle, batch 950, enjoyed 2.5 years after bottling, from Vinmonopolet Online]

DWF; From Vinmonopolet. Bottle 0, 33L. Batch 950. My No. 1200. Pours moderate, dark brown to black with a frothy, creamy, lasting and lacing tan head. Nose is moderate to heavy, roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, dark dried fruit, rich plums, vinious, light yeast, licorice and alcohol. Taste is heavy sweet and bitter with a lasting dark dried fruit, warming finish. Body is medium to full, texture is sticky to creamy, carbonation is flat to soft. Aii.. thanks.

Let just say that this is an amazing quadrupel. From the first smell till the last sip, this brings an amazing set of tastes. It has sweetness, references to port, alcoholic warmth, yet it is not alcoholic, fruity, low on carbonization. Every sip leaves you wanting more, but you also want to enjoy it to the fullest. Masterfull brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy (iOs)

Flaske 330 fra Vinmonopolet. Drukket i Skibotn 5 Sep 15. Svart. Raskt forsvinnende skum. Inviterende aroma av mandeldråper & mørke plommer. Rik sjokoladesmak & kaffe. Svakt tørr ettersmak. Hvor er alkoholen?

Bottle from De Hopduvel. Dark brown colour, beige foam. Sweet nose of red berries, caramel, grapes and red wine. Also malty with notes of chocolate. Tart hints of the wine. Very well balanced. Very nice beer! Complex, a sipper.
Flaske fra vinmonopolet. mørk brun uklar farge lavt karbonert. Moderat skum topp. Smaker krydder,brent karamell,gjær?,sjokolade og portvin og mørk frukt. Meget fornøyelig

330ml bottle - thanks martjoobolut
Big rich malty aroma. Sweet, but not too sticky. Very dark, seems pretty cloudy. Some sharp berries. Sweet malts, some dates. Heat definitely there, but as a sipper its not too imposing. However, its not quite doing it for me. A bit too sugary. Finish is nicely bitter though.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with beige head. Aroma is sweet, malt, wine, grapes, oak. Flavor is sweet, sour, red wine, oak, fruits, grapes. Finish is sweet and dry bitter. Overall: very good.

Dark brown beer, small tan head. Nose is red wine, berries, caramel, spicy notes, dried fruit. Flavor is chocolate and red wine, strawberry notes. Finishes with warming booze, dark chocolate, red berries. Lingering dark fruits plus chocolate cake. Somewhat sticky.

Bottle @Craigs. Pours black but with a red tinge, tan head. Red wine on the nose, berry fruits as well. Some caramel and chocolate on the taste big red wine as well. Some wood notes on the finish, this is a seriously good beer.

Aroma of red wine, dark fruits and berries, raisins. Smells a little like a barbershop. Flavors of sweet sticky, candied cherries, vanilla, sweet red wine, sweet pastry, brown sugar. Finish is sweet and boozy. As a dessert, this beer ticks all the right boxes! Delicious!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thick dark brown, muddied and a soft crust ringed head. Nose is gritty, vinious and warming. Initial taste is lean berry, bright spice and sherried up. Solid soft carbonation and polished mouthfeel. Finishes strongly, keen spiced berries and lingers welcoming berry and a flurry of very late tartness.

bottle at home ... dark black ... thick tan head ... dark black .. thin tan head... dark malts ... soft chocolate roast malts nose ... dark malts .. big soft red wine .. soft chocolate malts .. soft malts .. soft malts ... rich sweet malts .. soft chocolate ... soft sweet wine .. soft chocolate .. mellow roast ... wondefull
Bottle at Craigs. Pours hazy dark red brown with a thin ring of beige head. Aromas of red grape, toffee, red wine, light chocolate. Taste is more red wine. Clean, flinty finish.
Bottle at craigs. Pours deep ruby brown, nose is toffee, caramel, grapes, wood, taste is rich, fruity berry, caramel, dry, light oak.

Bottle. Pours a dark amber reddish color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty woody red wine aroma with hints of caramel. Sweetish malty spicy woody caramel and red wine flavor. Has a sweetish malty woody red wine finish.
Bottle @ nøgne ø smagning, aalborg. Aroma of sweet alcohol, dark dried fruits. Dark brown colour, no head. Heavy sweetness in taste. Full body, oily feel, avg. carbonation, sweet finish.

A dark brown, a head is very small and light brown. Aroma has rich and dried fruitness, raisins, some grapes and chocolate, hint of alcohol. Taste has raisins and dried fruits, quite strong sweetness, warming alcohol. Full bodied, smooth enough. Not enough complexicity, and too strong alcohol. Dried fruity and sweet Quad.

Bottle. Deep dark brown color with a red haze. Malty vinous aroma and flavor with dried fruit. Sweet, sharp alcohol. Toffee. Full bodied. Almost liquorish. Quite drinkable in spite of the almost sugary sweetness.

Smell of red wine, coffee. Dark brown colour, small dark brown head. Aroma of cognac, red wine, raisins, finishes with coffee and chocolate. Also red berries to be noted. Acidic. Mostly bitter, also sweet with burning alcohol sensation. Finish is faintly sour. Sharp carbon, oily texture.

(Bottle, 0.33 l - brygget 04.04.13 - batch #950, at Pikkulintu, 20150829) The beer poured black. Hardly any head was formed. Aroma had vanila, malts, wood, vineousness and booze. Palate was full bodied and warming with medium carbonation. Flavours were vanilla, malts, wood, sweetness, chocolate, vineousness and mildly bitterness. Aftertaste had wood, sweetness, booze and bitterness. A nice barrel aged brew in which the wood wasnt too dominating but unfortunately alcohol pushed through too heavily.

5th September 2015Almost opaque dark brown beer, small pale tan head. The nose is quite reminiscent of Port wine, nice! Palate is surprisingly light and semi dry. Decent fine carbonation. Modest malts, trace of toffee. Port wine and red wine kick in, vague tang and some aniseed. Rich berry fruits and a little spice. Touch of berry jam. Light finish brings a trace of bitterish wood. Warming afterglow. Excellent stuff, very Port like.
Aroma is a bit sour red wine. Not great but the taste explodes on the mouth. Licorice raisins malt notes. Complex in a good way. Medium sweetness. Light sweet finish.

Bottle at pikkulintu, helsinki. Almost black color, tanned head. Fantastic aroma has raisins, roasted malts, cognac notes. Balanced taste, raisins, roasted malts and sweet malts. Some coffee. Very good.

330ml bottle, batch nr. 950, from Vinmonopolet Langnes. Dark brown body with a reddish shade, fair fawn-coloued head. Fragile lacing. Moderate sherry, oak, and earthy malts on the nose. Sherry like flavours at first followed by the taste of plums, earth, and vanilla chocolate. Finish off with a lingering touch of dark fruity tartness added by alcohol warmth. Slow drinking beer, perfect enjoyment on a Friday eve at home (Tromsø 04.09.2015).

Dark mahogany brown colour with a light cream coloured head. Aroma of red wine, raisins, oak, almond/marzipan, vanilla, coffee and caramel. Very nice aroma but quite a boozy beer to drink, taste was sweet and syrupy with more red wine and dark fruits like plums and dates.

330 ml bottle. #950. Brewed on 04/04/13. 15.5%. Thanks Euphemos!
Dark reddish brown color with a tiny tan head.
Mild sourness, red berries, strong maltiness, sugary sweetness and chocolate in the aroma.
The flavor is port wine, red wine, strong maltiness, sweetness and enjoyability. 
Tasty, complex, balanced and enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 0.33l at Olhus Kopenhavn, Helsinki. Brygget 04.04.13. Batch nr: 950. Colour is brown with very small head. Aromas and flavours: Red wine, dark fruits, Belgian yeast, hints of raisins, sweetness and malts. When warming up gets more complex and very enjoyable. Nice soft maltiness and warming alcohol. Lingering aftertaste.

33 cl bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours dark brown with a small beige head. Wow! This is an awesome beer. Complex and rich. Aromas of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, vanilla, berries, alcohol and spices. Taste is sweet. Perfect for long winter nights with a lit fireplace.

Sampled from bottle @ Leuven Innovation Beer Festival. Hazy almost opaque dark brown color with a red glare coming through, small beige head. Aroma is malts, alcohol, wood. Taste malts, wood, alcohol, sweetish, lightly some fruits. Medium to full body, medium carbonation. Lingering fruity alcohol finish. Nice beer, heavy but nice.

Svart som torv med ett fint skumlag.lukter sterkt av kaffi og sjokolade.smaker kraftig.ett hint av rødvin?Litt for kraftig smak til at eg roper på meir.

Konklusjon:kraftig alkoholbombe som ikke blir det helt store for min del.

Dark brown colur, beige head. Aroma of dark fruits, red wine, vanilla, oak, cherries, dark chocolate, a little bit alcoholic. Taste is medium sweet, fruity flavour. Medium to full body, creamy texture, average to lively carbonation. You can feel the high ABV, but nice and complex.
Quite dark appearance with no head. Complex tastes of alcohol, caramel, chocolate, raisin
How: Bottle Appearance: mahogany color with a small off-white head. Aroma: red wine, sherry, dried fruits, plums, dark syrup, hint of chocholate. Palate: full body, soft carbonation.

Exquisita y Aromática cerveza. Esteres frutales en donde destacan los frutos rojos y las frutas secas, principalmente uvas, moras, higos y nueces. 

Color obscuro, prácticamente negro, espuma nula pir su alta potencia alcohólica, carbonatacion baja.

En boca nuevamente frutos rojos y fruta deshidratada. Su potencia alcohólica se percibe de forma cálida en garganta. 

Al paladar es compleja, ligeramente dulce pero a la vez bien integrada, deliciosa.

En resumen una excelente cerveza, no para maridar sino para degustar como un verdadero postre, pero con calma por su potencia alcohólica.

Sample at Leuven Innovation Beer Festival. Thanks for sharing todays beers!
APPEARANCE: brown beer.
NOSE: very alcohol.
TASTE: too much... Didnt really like this, but very well made.

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Aker Brygge, thanks Knudar. Pitch black color, some offwhite foam. Medium aroma intensity; raisins, malt, some roasted notes and sweet cherries- obvious barrel influence . . Full body & high complexity . The sweetness is way too much- ruins it a bit for me.
enjoyable- but expected more after some hype

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle shared by Arve_Christian - thanks! Pours somewhat hazy mahogany coloured with a modest, beige head. Rich malty aroma with wooden notes, dark fruits, raisins, alcohol and hints of red wine. Sweet, malty, flavourful and complex. Rather sweet and not too balanced yet, but tasty and nice still. Would like to try again in some years.

Bottle @ home. Brown beer with a small white head. Almost no head. Smell is bourbon, raisins, tannins, boozy, vanilla, bit sweet. Taste is chocolat, caramel, vanilla, boozy, sweet, dried fruits. Aftertaste is caramel, sweet, little bitter, fruity, alcohol punch. The aftertaste lasts for a while. Complex en quite interesting.

33cl bottle. Batch 950. Brewed 2013-04-04. No best before date. Dark black colour with some red hue. Minimal off-white head. Aroma is alcohol and oak at first. Ripe red berries follows and then coffee, caramel and syrup. Flavour is sweet but with some bitterness after a short while. Lots of alcohol and oak. Red berries and more citrus this time. Some coffee notes. Medium long aftertaste.

24/V/15 - sample @ LIBF (Leuven) - BB: n/a (2015-722)  Thanks to the Belgian (and Dutch, and...) RB crew for sharing todays beers!
Clear deep purplish brown beer, small to no head. Aroma: lots of bourbon, vanilla, sweet, raisins, dried fruits. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: alcohol, dried fruits, caramel, bit sugary, vanilla, sweet. Aftertaste: bourbon, alcohol, bit sourish, dried fruits, caramel, little hoppy.

Medium beige head. Hazy opaque dark brown body. Syrupy spicy aroma
with dried fruit and toffee notes. Sweet earthy spicy taste with dark
sugar and notes. Full-bodied. Hot, slightly fizzy mouthfeel. Sweet
earthy syrupy spicy aftertaste with dark sugar and caramel notes.
Its very sweet and the flavour is really intense. Im not convinced
Im enjoying this all that much. (0.33l bottle, gift from the brewery.
Batch #950. Label says just "Nøgne Ø Quadrupel".)

Fra flaske på sesongens siste M2, Cardinal juni-15: mørk brun med kort skum. Innbydende aroma av sviskeplommer, sherry og portvin. Smaken følger opp med en farlig god balanse og drikkbarhet, så stemningen rundt bordet er plutselig på full fart oppover. Blir sikkert enda bedre ved lagring, men det kan stille selvkontrollen på de største prøvelser. Batch 950 (brygget 040413), og det står ingenting om red wine barrel edition - hvor har rb tatt det fra?

Shared bottle at Mi2 at Cardinal 15.06.15. Cloudy dark brown. Small, beige head. At first fusel alcohol, then roasted barley, dark chocolate, vanilla. Similar taste, but balanced with hops and fresh dark berries in taste, with some berry sourness. Surprisingly crisp mouthfeel. Some bitterness in aftertaste. More like a barley wine or an American imperial stout than a Belgian Quadrupel, though.

Shared bottle at Cardinal,pours murky dfark brown with a tiny head. Aroma is dark malty, toffee and musty malts with some alcohol presence. Taste is moderate sweet malty,, heavy and balanced in a strange way, very good in total.

15,5%, ikke 13%. Brun med lavt skum. Noe eik, noe sjokolade, alkohol og hint av rødvin. Smaken består av mild eddik, frukt (fiken?), sukker, litt alkohol og rødvin. Noe vanilje også etterhvert som den varmes opp. Sursøt smak. Varmer naturlig nok nedover halsen. Gir assosiasjoner til portvin. Dette er i mine øyne dog ikke en quadrupel, selv om den er spennende nok. Medium konsistens, sursøt ettersmak. Bør lagres i mange år.

330 ml bottle, simply as Nøgne Ø Quadrupel, batch #950, soon available at Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 15.5%, 30 IBU. Very dark and opaque brown colour, nearly black. Moderate beige head. Aroma of fusel alcohols and oak / red wine barrel. Sweet flavour, molasses and oak galore, red wine and hints of liquorice and chocolate. Warming mouthfeel. Will probably improve substantially by further cellaring, maybe for as much as 10 years. Not a "Belgian" quadrupel though.

Dunkel bis schwarz. In der Nase Rotwein, dunkle Früchte, Trauben, brauner Zucker, etwas Säure. Am gAumen brauenr Zucker, Karamell, massiv Rotwein, süße im Abgang, möchtiger Körper, rund, wuchtig, alkoholisch.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2015 -review 700!- Deep brown with fizzy tan head. Red wine, chocolate, marzipan, oak, spice and leather. Thick and vinous palate. Rich, sweet, spice, licorice, oak, floral and red wine finish. Overall: Refined and subtle. Balances well between all the different elements. The beer needs time to breathe and settle in glass, significantly different beer after 30 min.

Bottle. Pours a dark murky mahogany brown body with a medium creamy beige head. Nose is raisins, alcohol, prunes, marzipan/almonds, vanilla, wood and hints of red wine, brown sugar, dates and figs. Taste is vanilla, wood, red wine, brown sugar, warming alcohol, rum, figs, raisins, almonds and hints of marzipan, red wine, licorice and figs. Full body, medium to high carbonation. There is something about the one I cant exactly put my finger on; dunno if the barrel has overdone itself or if the recipe itself is lacking a bit of subtlety. In either case, this version - as opposed to the very elegant and complex Aurora Australis (a natural comparison) - seems slightly "crude"; too sweet in an almond/marzipan kind of way and with a red wine hue on top which feels badly integrated. Perhaps its just my sky-high expectations to one of my favorite breweries brewing one of my favorite beer styles, but this beer just doesnt skyrocket quite as much as I would like it to. Still, a pretty decent beer; no doubt about it.

31.10.2014, cask @ Whats Brewing:
No head, just some bubbles. Aroma is slightly dry boozy, oak, alcohol, licorice, burnt caramel, dark malts, dried dark fruits, sour coffee, grass. Taste is slightly sweet, sugar, dark malts, sour coffee, oak, redwine, grass, berry skin, alcohol, licorice, bark, paper, minerals. Medium bitterness, slightly boozy mouthfeel. Nice enough.
Bottle at Leuven Innovation Beerfestival, thanks for sharing! Very sweet, sticky, lots of red wine, tannines, malty, alcoholic, very nice beer, but a true sipper.

15cl sample from bottle at the Leuven Innovation Beer Festival (25 V 2015). A massive full bodied quadrupel beer from Norway, labeled as 15.0% in alcohol... Although 13% wil be more accurate. The nose has dark and forest fruits, even some cherries. Lovely port and red wine notes sharpen the aroma. The thick, oily and sticky brew also hints at coffee and its taste is very nice, yet sweet. Maybe a that too sweet, sugary and sticky.

sampled from bottle at LIBF, poured an murky brown colour with a tanned head. nose of roasted malts, sweet ripe fruits, cloves, oak, baker sweet chocolate, sweet syrup, raisins, vineous oak notes, grapes, spicy alcohol notice, some vanilla sweetness, full bodied mouthfeel. nice brew

beige head leaves some lacing. coffee coloured. aroma is coffee, boozy, vanilla, candysugar, candico, spices. taste like aroma, red wine tanins, sweet, alcoholwarmth aftertaste sweet-sour from the wine. really blends well together. dense mouthfeel, medium carbonation. bottle @ LIBF 15/ bd apr-2013

Bottle sample @ Leuven Beer Innovation 2015, shared with the RB Belgian crew.
Brune foncée, col café au lait.
Arôme offre une belle profondeur des malts, caramel, grillé, léger chocolaté ponctué par un excellent bouquet de boisé et vin rouge qui arrive en rétro.
Palais est également fort centré sur les malts avec un petit côté levure belge très plaisant. Retrouve un petit fruité noir et sucre résiduel collant aux lèvres. Fini légèrement épicé. Le vin apporte une belle complexité et fait passer cette bière pour moins de 13%. Retrouve une petite note tourbée pour un fini devenant réchauffant. Dur de croire que cela est une quad.

Nearly black beer, red highlights; head gone in seconds. Roasted/burnt, vinous, liqueurish, but always with roasted notes. Vinous, roasted, sweet-bitterish. Some black chocolate under the hoppy bitterness; Bourbon, including vanilla. Very full bodied, viscous, great palate. Excellent big beer.

Super strong massieve ale with sticky, light beige, moussy and surprisingly stable head over a very dark reddish bronze robe. Very powerful, perfumey, absolutely delicious aroma of dozens of things, including chocolate, caramel, sweet cherries, marzipan, vanilla, banana, red wine, port, wood, brown sugar, candied dates, cinnamon... Sweet but not cloying in the mouth, very full and thick, multi-layered fruitiness and maltiness, complex, with suggestions of chocolate, banana, home made caramel, hazelnuts and vanilla, deep and warming, long finish which cannot hide the red wine factor, but somehow it blends in beautifully with the basic beer; woody tannins, spicy hops and liqueurish alcohol, the latter less obvious than I expected based on the towering ABV, build up a totally satisfying grand finale. This is a profound, huge, demanding and very complex, awe-inspiring ale - an achievement which stays reserved for only the most well-crafted quadrupels. Could be the best beer of the Leuven Innovation Beer Festival for me.
From tap. Pours hazy dark brown to black with a small tan heqd. Aroma is roasted malty, overripe fruity. Smooth roasted, fruity and dark malty. Bitter and breadish dark malty finish.

Bottle. Pours a very dark brown with light creamy head. Aromas of caramel, sweet malts, coffee, light pine and a little licorice. Flavors of syrupy brown sugar, big sweet malts, chicory, and light pine. Warm. Wow

Thanks for sharing! Sampled bottled @ Leuven Innovation Beer Festival. Dark red brown, little head. Huge sweet & chewy vinous syrupy nose, chocolate, warming, malty, oak, rich, Thick warming syrupy, chocolate, warming, spirit-qualities, strongly vinous, thick sweet barrel, syrup, light bitter oak, caramel, light fruit,.. Thick, chewy & syrupy, Rich, Nice brew, tasted even stronger than 13 % ABV.
One of the bigger surprises for me. A bit to sweet probably, but for me that is ok.

Trübes dunkel orange braunes Bier mit einer geringen braunen schaumkrone. Geruch nach reifen Früchten, Karamell, holzig, alkoholisch. Geschmack sehr kräftig malzig, reifes Obst, alkoholisch, Karamell, holzig.
Svart farge med lyst beige skum. Mørke stenfrukter, alkohol. Smaker veldig søtt og godt:-).Fyldig med masser av smaker. Alkoholvarme og søtlig laaang avslutning.

Svart med fingerhøyt lys brunt skum. Lukter trevirke, vanilje, alkohol, svisker, noe papp og noe sideraktig, mye som foregår her. Søt start, svisker, noe kandis, mørke frukter. Noe salt og medium lang lett bittersøt avslutning.

Bottle 0,33l. Pours a black colour with an airy head that quickly diminish and leaves no lacing. Aroma is leather, wooden barrels, vanilla and tannins. Taste is sweet roasted malts, brown sugar, alcohol, dark fruits, with leather, tobacco, vanilla and tannins. Creamy body, with soft carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Vinmonopolets BU. Batch 950. 15.5% ABV. Served in trappist glass. Pours dark brown. A bit hazy. Almost non-existing head, apart from some brown bubbles. Red wine, blackcurrant, ripe cherry nose. Alcohol. Very thick body. oily. Low, but somehow a bit frizzy, carbonation. Very sweet, with slight hints of sour. Some balancing bitterness. Wineous flavours, somewhere between a rather sweet red wine and a port. Blackcurrant, ripe cherry and red fruit flavour as well. Leather, hint of chocolate, raisins. Alcohol is well hidden. Some warming mouth feel, as you would expect. Best enjoyed at room temperature, it gets a lot better as it gets warmer. A big, bold and good beer, even though the flavours from the barrel aging takes up too much space in my opinion. I would love to try a version without the barrel aging.

Bottle bought at Den Nordiske Ølhandel in Copenhagen during CBC 2015

Almost black with a small head. Aroma of alcohol, oak and some light red wine. The taste was similar but better. Vinous and with some fruit and light caramel. The finish was long. Potent stuff.
Svart farve med beige skum. Lukt av rødvin, eik og røyk. Smak av røstet malt, frukt, rosin og plommer. Maltet fruktvinavslutning. Vinmonopolet.

Lukt: Rødvin aktig duft sammen med noe alkohol.
Utseende: Mørk brun, nesten sort.
Skum/kullsyre: Tynt skum, ring langs kant.
Smak: Fløyelsmyk rødvinaktig smak med en liten toning av karamell i ettersmaken sammen med en alko varmer.

@ Basunen 15-5-16: lite svag doft av alkohol och trä. Smaken är bättre med tydliga toner av torkat frukt och fat. Ganska vinös och potent. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
---- Soberness not garanteed!

Quadrupel Fra Nøgne Ø er en dessertøl på 15,5% og 30IBU. Kjøpt for 88,50,- NOK på Vinmonopolet på Linderud. Fargen på det minimalistiske skummet er lys beige. Fargen på ølen er uklar mørkebrunt, nærmest som kaffe. Karbonering er myk og under middels. Aromaen inneholder røde plummer, svisker, rødvin og en anelse rosin. Smaken består av røstet malt, rødvin, mørk sjokolade og relativt søt. Ettersmaken er søt og alkoholen har en varmende følelse. Flott kropp på ølen.

Bottle enjoyed at Cafe Sara
Very dark, brown head. Smell of dark fruity malts, raisins, plums, red wine, toffee, quite complex. Heavy sweet, plums, raisins, some wine acids, oak, dark malts, alot of complexity. Moderate bitter, fruit peel. Excellent Quad!

Bottle at Home from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: really dark clear brown beer with no carbonation and really small brown head. Smell: caramel and brown sugar, malt domination and bread. Taste: very good taste of a quadrupel, total control of the style. Good caramel taste and bread. Caramel finish and brown sugar. Aftertaste: good caramel finish. For a 15,5 ABV you dont feel this level of alcohol. Good job !!!
Whats Brewing 2014. Red dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is red wine, alcohol, sugar, oak. Flavour is red wine, alcohol, sugar, oak, dried fruits. Boozy beer , but also a nice warming one.
Dark ruby with small head. SSome prunes, red wine, chocolaty, very boozy. Sticky. Ok to try

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2015 Cask, at Whats Brewing. A brown beer, lightly unclear, and more or less headless. It has a vinous aroma with a light touch of acetone. Chocolate, more like cocoa actually, some dark dried fruits and a touch of dark sugar too. The flavor is quite sweet, with a healthy dose of alcohol. Red wine, cocoa, prunes and some dark sugar. Full-bodied, warming and soft on the palate, the carbonation level going well with this kind of beer. Lasting finish. Sure, its a bit too warming, but its a delicious beer I was stupid enough to have several glasses of. Rating: 8-3-8-4-16-3.9.141031Bottle. Very close to one year since I drank the cask edition of this beer, I found the time to look closer into the bottled edition. It looks more or less the same, except it has a cute little beige head on top. Some lacings too. Its vinous on the nose, more rounded than it was a year ago, even some months ago, and rather complex. Cocoa, red wine, prunes and raisins, some alcohol, a woody scent and some brown sugar. Its sweet on the palate, not unexpected considering the ABV, but its far from cloying. The alcohol cleans up quite a bit. Red wine, cocoa, dark dried fruits, dark sugar and some tannins and vanilla-ish wood in the flavor. Theres bitterness present, but very subdued, and it feels only lightly warming on the palate. Full body and a very smooth carbonation. Chocolate, roasted notes, dark dried fruits, red wine, alcohol and sweetness in the finish. Certainly a beer that did well from a year of cellaring, and of course it looks more sexy from a bottle than from cask. Just wonderful this one, just wonderful. 151029

Sampler from cask at Whats Brewing 2014, Stavanger. Clear deep mahogany colored body with a bubbly white rim. Dates, raisins, port and booze on the nose. Oak, vanilla, port, sweet and acidic flavors on the tongue. Pleasant fruity barrel notes. Full bodied, flat and oily with a suiting alco warmth.

Cask @ Whats Brewing, Stavanger. Pours black, with an airy head. Aroma is leather, wooden barrels, vanilla and tannins. Creamy body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is sweet roasted malts, with leather, tobacco, vanilla and tannins.
Cask at Whats Brewing. Deep brown with a red hue. Aroma is sweet, red wine, lots of oak and some smoke(?). Taste is full, sweet, prunes, sweet plums and oak. Very nice!

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2015 On tap (cask) at What?s Brewing beer festival 2014, Stavanger. Pours dark ruby brown with small head. Aroma of plums, raisins, red wine, dark chocolate, alcohol. Very sweet.Update: Shared bottle at Mi2 at Cardinal, Stavanger. Aroma strongly dominated by alcohol; plums, raisins, red wine. Taste very sweet and  fruity, with some liquorice and red wine - and lots of alcohol.

Cask @ Whats Brewing 2014, Stavanger
Pours clear brown with a few off-white bubbles. Aroma has notes of malt, dried fruits, cocoa, hint of chocolate, red wine, alcohol and hint of wood. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and light bitter with a long warm, dried fruity and vinous finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
